titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الصَّائِمِ يَذُوقُ الْقِدْرَ وَ يَزُقُّ الْفَرْخَ
titles.en: Chapter 34 – Regarding the Fasting one who tastes (from) the cooking pot, and tastes (for) the chicks (young children)

titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الصَّائِمِ يَزْدَرِدُ نُخَامَتَهُ وَ يَدْخُلُ حَلْقَهُ الذُّبَابُ
titles.en: Chapter 35 – Regarding the Fasting-one who swallows his mucus and the fly enters into his throat
Chapter 33 – Chewing gum for the Fasting one

titles.ar: بَابٌ فِي الصَّائِمِ يَذُوقُ الْقِدْرَ وَ يَزُقُّ الْفَرْخَ
titles.en: Chapter 34 – Regarding the Fasting one who tastes (from) the cooking pot, and tastes (for) the chicks (young children)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (16/297)

parts.text: أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ
الْمَرْأَةِ الصَّائِمَةِ تَطْبُخُ الْقِدْرَ فَتَذُوقُ الْمَرَقَةَ تَنْظُرُ إِلَيْهِ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ سُئِلَ عَنِ الْمَرْأَةِ الصَّائِمَةِ تَطْبُخُ الْقِدْرَ فَتَذُوقُ الْمَرَقَةَ تَنْظُرُ إِلَيْهِ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ قَالَ

text: وَ سُئِلَ عَنِ الْمَرْأَةِ يَكُونُ لَهَا الصَّبِيُّ وَ هِيَ صَائِمَةٌ فَتَمْضَغُ الْخُبْزَ وَ تُطْعِمُهُ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ وَ الطَّيْرَ إِنْ كَانَ لَهَا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahi, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having been asked about the Fasting woman cooking in the pot, so she tastes the stock awaiting over it. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem’. He (the narrator) said, ‘And he<sup>asws</sup> was asked about the woman who happens to have the child for her, and she is Fasting, so she chews the bread and feeds it to him. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem, and the bird, if there was one for her’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a fasting woman who tastes to examine the salt of a cooking pot. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful.’” He (the narrator) has said that he asked him (the Imam) about a fasting woman who has a child and she chews the bread to feed him. He (the Imam) said, ‘It is not harmful. So also is the case of a bird that belongs to her.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (6/297)

narrator_chain.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا بَأْسَ لِلطَّبَّاخِ وَ الطَّبَّاخَةِ أَنْ يَذُوقَ الْمَرَقَ وَ هُوَ صَائِمٌ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moalla Bin Muhammad, from Al Hassan Bin Ali Al Washa, from Aban Bin Usman, from Al Husayn Bin Ziyad,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is no problem for the male cook and the female cook if they taste the broth, and he is (they are) Fasting’.
en.sarwar: 2. Al-Husayn ibn Muhammad has narrated from Mu‘alla’ ibn Muhammad from al-Hassan ibn Ali al-Washsha’ from Aban ibn ‘Uthman from al-Husayn ibn Ziyad who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘It is not harmful for a male or female fasting cook to taste and examine the salt of food in the cooking pot.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (16/297)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ هَارُونَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ مَسْعَدَةَ بْنِ صَدَقَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ فَاطِمَةَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهَا كَانَتْ تَمْضَغُ لِلْحَسَنِ ثُمَّ لِلْحُسَيْنِ صَلَوَاتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِمَا وَ هِيَ صَائِمَةٌ فِي شَهْرِ رَمَضَانَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Haroun Bin Muslim, from Mas’ada Bin Sadaqa,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said that Syeda Fatima<sup>asws</sup> would chew for Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, then Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup>, and she<sup>asws</sup> was Fasting during the Month of Ramazan’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from Harun ibn Muslim from Mas’adah ibn Sadaqah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Fatimah, ‘Alayha al-Salam, would chew food for al- Hassan and al-Husayn, ‘Alayhim al-Salam, when she was fasting in the month of Ramadan.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (6/298)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ النُّعْمَانِ عَنْ سَعِيدٍ الْأَعْرَجِ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الصَّائِمِ يَذُوقُ الشَّيْ‏ءَ وَ لَا يَبْلَعُهُ قَالَ لَا .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Husayn Bin Saeed, from Ali Bin No’man, from Saeed Al A’araj who said,
‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> about the Fasting-one who tastes the thing, and does not swallow it’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No’.
en.sarwar: 4. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Husayn ibn Sa’id from Ali ibn al-Nu’man from Sa‘id al-’A’raj who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of one who while fasting, tastes something but does not swallow. He (the Imam) said, ‘No, it not permissible.’”
